column4: OK. I was under the impression that while XFS is supported (since its well supported in the kernel etc).. the installation proceedure might not support it all that well in terms of setting it up on a purely XFS only system... where even /boot is an XFS mount....
it's a bit smaller, and a bit quicker.  If you don't need the extra reliability you might want to make that engineering trade off of accepting ext3 characteristics
so you agree XFS is more reliable then?
yes, from my testing and from what I've read, I would agree
